definition: apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc

sentences.english: A covered bridge traverses the stream.
sentences.chinese: 一座有頂蓋的橋橫跨這條河流。

sentences.english: The overall equipment is composed of top cover, left and right plates, rear and front door plates and ventilation trough.
sentences.chinese: 整體設備由頂蓋，左右側板，前後門板及通風槽組成。

sentences.english: Human Josh lifts the link rig and rubs his temples.
sentences.chinese: 人形的Jake掀開頂蓋，揉了揉自己的太陽穴。

sentences.english: Decided not to bid on the roll-top desk.
sentences.chinese: 決定不投標那張頂蓋可捲縮的寫字檯。

sentences.english: It has a glass top that swivels open, providing storage.
sentences.chinese: 它有一個玻璃的頂蓋，可以旋轉打開，供儲藏。

sentences.english: Both filters are top-loading and include element indicators in the cap.
sentences.chinese: 幷包括濾芯發訊器在頂蓋上。

sentences.english: Head cover is of a welded structure of the Q235 steel plate with sufficient strength.
sentences.chinese: 頂蓋爲Q235鋼板焊接結構，具有足夠的剛強度。

sentences.english: The matte-gray top cover comes off first.
sentences.chinese: 先打開小的灰色的頂蓋。

sentences.english: Well, there was a roof-rack on the roof.
sentences.chinese: 啊，汽車頂蓋上有鐵架子。

sentences.english: The coins can be easily removed by sliding off the top of the bank.
sentences.chinese: 滑開儲蓄罐的頂蓋硬幣可以輕鬆取出。

sentences.english: The frontal corticoteetal fibers passed through the internal capsule and the cerebral peduncle.
sentences.chinese: 額葉皮質至頂蓋的投射路經內囊和大腦腳。

sentences.english: Reading and writing table with its top raised.
The top is removed before use to reveal soft bristles.
sentences.chinese: 使用之前將頂蓋拔出露出柔軟的刷毛。

sentences.english: The top cover is rotated and closed over the fuze.
sentences.chinese: 頂蓋是在引信旋轉和封閉。

sentences.english: The open type of top cover can be easy for repair and maintenance.
sentences.chinese: 開啓式的車頭頂蓋，易於維修保養。

definition: the spongy, white pulp inside the stem of rush plants, used as a wick for oil lamps
the cap of a pen, pencil or writing brush/the sheath of a pen (made of cloth, silk or thread)
